content.description: Start in the cave on the deepest jugs; move through good ledges and walk the feet across; transfer feet with some core tension and hooks to obtain a good but crumbly hold to exit the cave and get onto the face; with hands on the ledge, find your feet and make a mantle to top out. Refer to photos for route idea. A nice cleaning brush will help with loose debris/sand/soil. Standout movements and a fantastic finish.
content.protection: Sand; a crash pad may help protect from tree stumps at the cave/face transition.
content.location: Follow area directions; West-most cliff band with a cave-like opening. Follows the line through the cave and up the flat rectangular face.Â

content.description: West-most, North facing cliff band. Frames Lake Huron's beach and is nearby some vacation homes. This band is near but separate from the "A,C,J boulder" as it is located on the sand rather than in the tides, about 15 meters South of it. Lots of tagging and hideous spray paint litters the cliff band, a sign you're close, but this area/cave is relatively clean.
